results.title: The Infinite voyage
results.creator_credit: Chip Walter, National Academy of Sciences and WQED
results.brief_description: Focusing on current and compelling scientific topics, this series is a unique visual presentation that inspires students to see their world in new ways and discover how modern technologies contribute to scientific discovery. These programs go beyond the latest technology reports in newspapers, magazines, and television to the personal stories of people at the boundaries of scientific research. A journey to the very brink of scientific exploration where individuals and technology meet the unknown.

results.title: Fires of the mind: workings of the human brain
results.creator_credit: Chip Walter, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Infinite voyage”.
Outlines findings of current research into the workings of the human brain - its anatomy and physiology, discoveries concerning its evolution and research into such areas as memory, the sense of self, and the human mind’s ability to reflect upon itself.

results.title: Unseen worlds: imaging from atoms to outer space
results.creator_credit: Steve Eder, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Infinite voyage”.
Examines a wide range of imaging techniques and their many and varied applications, such as anthropologists using computer technology to probe the remains of Egyptian mummies to discover previously unknown facts about the health and life-style of these people, or doctors using magnetic imaging to view the brain and other organs to provide treatment without resorting to invasive techniques like exploratory surgery.

results.title: The Road to interdependence
results.creator_credit: Paul Auerswald, Hal Weiner, Marilyn Weiner and Screenscope Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The History of United States foreign relations”.
A commentary by the U.S. Department of State, on United States foreign relations since the second World War, using original film clippings. It emphasises the role of the United States in such events as the Cold War, Vietnam and the Middle East Crisis.

results.title: The Reluctant world power
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The History of United States foreign relations”.
The third in a series which traces the development of American foreign relations. The period between 1914 and 1941 was one in which America was torn between the policies of isolationism and involvement outside its boundaries. Focuses on Wilson’s policies of involvement in European affairs during and after the First World War. A backlash caused a return to isolationism in the 1920s and 1930s which was followed by partial involvement in Europe at the beginning of World War II and America’s full commitment to the war in Europe and the Pacific in 1941.

results.title: Youth to maturity
results.creator_credit: Paul Auerswald and United States. Dept. of State
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The History of United States foreign relations”.
The second in a series which traces the development of American foreign relations. In the nineteenth century, western expansion across the continent and the Pacific, shaped American foreign relations. Sketches of outstanding diplomats, such as Perry, and America’s relations with European and Asian nations during the war with Mexico, the opening of Japan, the Civil War, the Spanish-American War, the eras of the ‘Open Door’ Policy and Theodore Roosevelt’s presidency.

results.title: An Age of revolutions: USA
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The History of United States foreign relations”.
The first in a series which traces the development of American foreign relations. Presents a history of the United States from before the American War of Independence to the compilation of the Monroe Doctrine in the early nineteenth century. Focuses on America’s first ambassador, Benjamin Franklin, and American relations with the European powers during the War of Independence, the French Revolution and the era of Napoleon, the War of 1812 and the formulation of the Monroe Doctrine.

results.title: Respiratory system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
The organs of the respiratory system; mechanics of ventilation and physics of diffusion between alveoli and capillaries; effect on respiratory system of varying needs for oxygen; function of respiratory system in providing needed oxygen and eliminating carbon dioxide.

results.title: Skeleton
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human Body”.
A study of the skeleton, the basic framework of the body. Describes the bones that make up various parts of the skeleton and their function in providing support and protection to vital organs and in affording body mobility.
